title: Datalad status null when there are changes to commit
body:
#### What is the problem?
Running `datalad status` after `datalad remove` shows no output, but `git status` shows changes to be commited. Not sure if this is normal.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Create a a testme subdataset. Save the superdataset. Remove the subdataset, and run `datalad status; git status`. My log:
```sh
[dorian@mri processed]$ datalad remove --nocheck testme
remove(ok): /DATA/FEDERATED_DATASETS/study1/data/processed/testme (dataset)
[dorian@mri processed]$
[dorian@mri processed]$ git status
On branch master
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        deleted:    testme

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
[dorian@mri processed]$ datalad status
[dorian@mri processed]$
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
datalad 0.12.0rc6 on CentOS 7

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
N/A
